title: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
snippets: The FSB say they detained a "Ukrainian special services agent". Kyiv has not commented on the attack.
titles: Russia detains suspect in car bomb attack that killed general
summary: The Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) announced the detention of an individual they describe as a "Ukrainian special services agent." As of now, there has been no official response or comment from Kyiv regarding the detention or the circumstances surrounding the alleged attack.

title: Russia claims it has regained full control of Kursk from Ukraine
snippets: Ukraine denies Russian claims it has been forced out of the border region.
titles: Russia claims it has regained full control of Kursk from Ukraine
summary: Ukraine has refuted Russian assertions that Ukrainian forces have been expelled from a contested border area. Despite Russia's claims of having pushed Ukrainian troops out, Ukraine maintains its position within the region, indicating ongoing disputes and lack of resolution in the area's control status.

title: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
snippets: At least four people have been killed and 500 more injured in Bandar Abbas.
titles: Moment driver sees huge explosion rip through Iran port
summary: At least four individuals have died and another 500 have been injured in Bandar Abbas. The cause and further details regarding the incident have not been provided in the information available.

title: Chris Eubank Jr beats Conor Benn on unanimous points decision
snippets: Fierce rivals go the distance in middleweight bout as their famous fathers watch on at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.
titles: Chris Eubank Jr beats Conor Benn on unanimous points decision
summary: In a highly anticipated middleweight boxing match at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, fierce rivals faced off in a bout that went the full distance. The event was notable for the presence of their famous fathers, who watched from the audience. The summary does not specify the outcome of the match or the participants involved.

title: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
snippets: Entire Strip, with a population of two million people, may be on the brink of famine as WFP runs out of supplies.
titles: Thirteen killed, dozens under rubble as Israel bombs Gaza amid food crisis
summary: The Strip, home to two million inhabitants, faces a potential famine due to the World Food Programme (WFP) running out of supplies. This critical shortage threatens the food security of the entire population.

title: 2025 NFL Draft picks by college team, school: SEC, Big Ten dominate as Ohio State flirts with record
snippets: The power programs dominated the 2025 NFL Draft
titles: 2025 NFL Draft picks by college team, school: SEC, Big Ten dominate as Ohio State flirts with record
summary: In the 2025 NFL Draft, the most successful and prominent college football programs were the primary sources of top talent. These elite programs significantly influenced the draft outcomes, with their players being selected in the early rounds. This dominance highlights the consistent ability of these power programs to develop NFL-ready athletes.

title: Joshua Farmer comes to New England with massive chip on shoulder
snippets: Patriots defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is out to prove all the teams that passed on him wrong.
titles: Joshua Farmer comes to New England with massive chip on shoulder
summary: Joshua Farmer, a defensive lineman for the Patriots, is motivated to demonstrate his value by outperforming expectations. This comes after being overlooked by multiple teams. He aims to prove those teams made a mistake by not selecting him.

title: More McIlroy magic at PGA pairs event but Novak and Griffin lead
snippets: Rory McIlroy shrugged off a 90-minute storm delay and sank a 30-foot eagle putt to steal the show in Saturday's four-ball format third round of the PGA Zurich Classic."I think the secret is not thinking about it in those 90 minutes.
titles: More McIlroy magic at PGA pairs event but Novak and Griffin lead
summary: Rory McIlroy overcame a 90-minute storm delay during the third round of the PGA Zurich Classic, impressively making a 30-foot eagle putt in Saturday's four-ball format. His performance highlighted the event, with McIlroy attributing his success to not dwelling on the delay.

title: DWU softball splits regular-season ending doubleheader against Morningside
snippets: Apr. 26—MITCHELL — The Dakota Wesleyan University softball team split its final two games of the regular season in a doubleheader with Morningside on Saturday at McWhirter Field. Behind a complete-game shutout performance from Alison Ernsberger and a fifth-inning two-run home run from Sophie Wietzema, the Tigers took game one 4-0. However, Morningside (29-15, 17-5 GPAC) took the second game ...
titles: DWU softball splits regular-season ending doubleheader against Morningside
summary: The Dakota Wesleyan University softball team ended their regular season with a split in a doubleheader against Morningside at McWhirter Field on Saturday. The Tigers won the first game 4-0, thanks to Alison Ernsberger's complete-game shutout and Sophie Wietzema's fifth-inning two-run homer. However, Morningside (29-15, 17-5 GPAC) claimed victory in the second game.

title: Jimmy Butler sitting out for Warriors in Game 3 of first-round series against Rockets
snippets: Warriors star Jimmy Butler is out for Game 3 of Golden State’s first-round playoff series against the Houston Rockets on Saturday night after injuring his pelvis and suffering a deep gluteal muscle contusion in a hard fall during Game 2.  The best-of-seven series is tied at one game apiece with the next two games on the Warriors' home floor.
titles: Jimmy Butler sitting out for Warriors in Game 3 of first-round series against Rockets
summary: Golden State Warriors' Jimmy Butler will miss Game 3 of the first-round playoff series against the Houston Rockets due to a pelvis injury and a deep gluteal muscle contusion sustained in Game 2. The series is currently tied 1-1, with the next two games set to be played on the Warriors' home court.

title: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
snippets: Proposal to fold the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board into the SEC will boost Donald Trump’s deregulatory agenda
titles: Republicans plan to scrap US audit regulator
summary: A proposal has been made to integrate the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB) into the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This move is seen as a step that would advance former President Donald Trump's agenda aimed at reducing regulatory burdens.

title: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
snippets: Sandy Cay is just kilometres from the Philippines’ military outpost at Thitu Island
titles: China seizes disputed reef in the South China Sea
summary: Sandy Cay, located only a few kilometers away from Thitu Island, serves as a significant point of interest due to its proximity to the Philippines' military outpost.

title: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
snippets: Russia acknowledges presence of North Korean troops on the ground for the first time
titles: Kremlin claims to have pushed Ukraine out of Kursk as Trump criticises Putin
summary: For the first time, Russia has officially acknowledged the presence of North Korean troops on the ground. This marks a significant development, as it is the first admission of North Korean military involvement. The implications of this acknowledgment and the details of the troops' activities or numbers were not disclosed.

title: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
snippets: World leaders gathered in Rome as US and Ukrainian presidents met for first time since Oval Office row
titles: Trump and Zelenskyy hold ‘productive’ discussion at Pope’s funeral
summary: World leaders convened in Rome, marking the first meeting between the US and Ukrainian presidents since their disagreement in the Oval Office. This gathering signifies a step towards diplomatic engagement amidst previous tensions.

title: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
snippets: Move by employees at Google’s AI arm follows discontent after weapons and surveillance pledge is dropped
titles: DeepMind UK staff seek to unionise and challenge defence deals and Israel links
summary: Employees at Google's AI division have expressed their dissatisfaction following the company's decision to abandon a pledge against working on weapons and surveillance projects. This move has sparked concerns among the workforce regarding the ethical implications of their work.

title: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
snippets: The less intensively you manage the soil, the better the soil can function. Such as not plowing as often or using more grass-clover mixtures as cover crops. Surprisingly, it applies to both conventional and organic farming.
titles: Less intensive farming works best for agricultural soil
summary: Research indicates that reducing the intensity of soil management improves its functionality across both conventional and organic farming systems. Practices such as minimizing plowing and incorporating grass-clover mixtures as cover crops have been identified as beneficial. This approach supports healthier soil ecosystems, applicable to various agricultural methods.
